CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 13, 1958, pg. B4 reads: "Record Holder - William E. Rouse, motor vehicle operator, third from left, receives a National Safety Council safe-driver award from Assistant Postmaster B.L. Kelly, second from left, for driving a Post Office mail truck safely for 24 years - a top record. The award ceremony took place on Sept. 6 in Courtroom 6, with E.C. Timmerman Jr., secretary-manager of AAA, and C.L. Sabo, superintendent of postal vehicle maintenance force, looking on. - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Assistant Postmaster B.L. Kelly presenting a National Safety Council safe-driver award to William E. Rouse, with E.C. Timmerman Jr. and C.L. Sabo, standing in Courtroom Six with wooden paneling
